name: Salt Lake City
title: Trump's education secretary threatens to pull funding from NY over its Native American mascot ban
description: New York is discriminating against a school district that refuses to get rid of its Native American chief mascot and could face a Justice Department investigation or risk losing federal funding, President Donald Trump’s top education official said Friday.  U.S. Secretary of Education Linda McMahon, on a visit to Massapequa High School on Long Island, said an investigation by her agency has determined that state education officials violated Title VI of the federal civil rights law by banning the use of Native American mascots and logos statewide.  McMahon described Massapequa's chiefs mascot as an “incredible” representation of Native American leadership as she made the announcement backed by dozens of students and local officials in the high school gymnasium.

name: New York City
title: Trump's education secretary threatens to pull funding from NY over its Native American mascot ban
description: President Donald Trump’s top education official says her department has determined that New York is discriminating against a school district that is refusing a state order to get rid of its Native American chief mascot. U.S. Secretary of Education Linda McMahon said on a visit to Massapequa High School on Long Island on Friday that the state could risk looking federal funding or face a Justice Department investigation. McMahon says her department will be asking the state to voluntarily sign a resolution rescinding its ban on Native American mascots and allowing districts to continue using the image and name of their choosing.

description: NEW CUMBERLAND — Hancock County Schools officials are confident there won’t be any major hurdles as a result of the next fiscal budget, but noted there is some uncertainty as a result of federal funds. The county school board approved its budget for the 2025-2026 fiscal year, beginning in July, on Tuesday. Finance Director Joe […]

name: Education Funding
title: Congresswoman Sarah McBride helps Georgetown Boys & Girls Club seek federal funding
description: The organization has outgrown its current facility, and staff hope to relocate to an upgraded building where they can welcome more students.

name: Education Funding
title: Oregon’s school funding formula undercounts poverty, denying some districts millions. Lawmakers are poised to approve it anyway
description: Oregon has more accurate datasets. But statute requires that the funding formula use on child poverty estimates the U.S. Census Bureau generates each year, which are less precise.

name: Louisiana
title: Louisiana Senate will reduce funding for Gov. Landry’s private school vouchers, chamber leader says
description: The Louisiana Senate president said his chamber will dramatically scale back funding for the new private school voucher program

name: New York City
title: OP-ED: Will NYC stand up to Trump’s education agenda or fall in line?
description: Many New Yorkers may now question whether the City will continue to stand as a stronghold against the Trump administration’s harmful policies.
